intro: Taraxacum herae, commonly known as the Hæra's dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of serrated, hairy leaves and a yellow flower head that develops into a fluffy white pappus for wind dispersal. Native to southern Europe, it thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats. The plant has a taproot system and is often found in meadows and along roadsides. Its botanical features make it a common yet distinctive member of the dandelion genus.
